method.name: Initialize::
method.comment: Turn off automatic collection by adding a new key to your #PlistExtra: FirebaseCrashlyticsCollectionEnabled Initializes the library inside the Application_Start function. You should initialize FirebaseAnalytics before initializing this library.

method.name: setCrashlyticsCollectionEnabled:
method.comment: Enable collection for select users by calling the Crashlytics data collection override at runtime. The override value persists across launches of your app so Crashlytics can automatically collect reports. To opt out of automatic crash reporting, pass false as the override value. When set to false, the new value does not apply until the next run of the app

method.name: isCrashlyticsCollectionEnabled
method.comment: Check if automatically report collection is enabled or not

method.name: Log:
method.comment: Add custom log messages NOTE: To avoid slowing down your app, Crashlytics limits logs to 64kB and deletes older log entries when a session's logs go over that limit.

method.name: didCrashDuringPreviousExecution
method.comment: Detect when a crash happens during your app's last run.

method.name: checkForUnsentReports
method.comment: Check for unsent reports You must set setCrashlyticsCollectionEnabled to false in order to use hasUnsentReports If there is any unsent report the EventName_HasUnsentReports event will be raised
